intro: Cerastium boissieri var. abbreviatum, commonly known as the dwarf mouse-ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features small, rounded leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or as a ground cover in alpine settings.
